channel.title: process_creation on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in process_creation on My New Hugo Site

item.title: BPFtrace Unsafe Option Usage
item.description: Detects the usage of the unsafe bpftrace option

item.title: Linux Doas Tool Execution
item.description: Detects the doas tool execution in linux host platform.

item.title: Linux Crypto Mining Indicators
item.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners

item.title: Clipboard Collection with Xclip Tool
item.description: Detects attempts to collect data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool. Xclip has to be installed. Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of clipboard utilities on user workstations.

item.title: Commands to Clear or Remove the Syslog
item.description: Detects specific commands commonly used to remove or empty the syslog.

item.title: DD File Overwrite
item.description: Detects potential overwriting and deletion of a file using DD.

item.title: Linux Webshell Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious sub processes of web server processes

item.title: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteScript
item.description: Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteScript to execute any UNIX/Linux script using the /bin/sh shell. Script being executed gets created as a temp file in /tmp folder with a scx* prefix. Then it is invoked from the following directory /etc/opt/microsoft/scx/conf/tmpdir/. The file in that directory has the same prefix scx*. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including Microsoft Operations Manager. Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

item.title: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteShellCommand
item.description: Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider Invoke_ExecuteShellCommand to execute any UNIX/Linux command using the /bin/sh shell. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including Microsoft Operations Manager. Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

item.description: Detects disabling security tools

item.description: Detects clear logs

item.description: Detects usage of base64 utility to decode arbitrary base64-encoded text

item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover files and directories

item.description: Detects file deletion commands

item.title: Linux Network Service Scanning
item.description: Detects enumeration of local or remote network services.

item.title: Linux Remote System Discovery
item.description: Detects the enumeration of other remote systems.

item.title: Local Groups Discovery
item.description: Detects enumeration of local system groups

item.title: Local System Accounts Discovery
item.description: Detects enumeration of local systeam accounts

item.title: Process Discovery
item.description: Detects process discovery commands

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Scheduled Task/Job At
item.description: Detects the use of at/atd

item.title: Security Software Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep for now) to discover security software discovery

item.title: System Information Discovery
item.description: Detects system information discovery commands

item.title: System Network Connections Discovery
item.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

item.title: System Network Discovery - Linux
item.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration
